word: The Responsibility of Parents for Prenatal Influence.--The first great object to be attained in the training of children is soundness of constitution which will prepare the way in a great measure for mental and moral training. Physical and moral health are closely united. What an enormous weight of responsibility rests upon parents when we consider that the course pursued by them before the birth of their children has very much to do with the development of their character after their birth.--HL (Part 2) 32, 1865. (2SM 426.)
